Hi, do you have all the pre-requisites listed in the URL below?

http://www.eclipse.org/bpel/install.php
yes, I have all that added. I was also able to compile it on the eclipse installation. That somehow should prove that everything is installed, right?

(sorry I don't know how familiar you are with Eclipse, so here are some basic questions)

Are running a runtime-workbench? A quick way to do that is to choose the menu Run->Run As->Eclipse Application.

And it is in this new workspace that you connect to CVS again and load the examples.

no problem about asking these questions.

I am running the eclipse workbench.
I used an external CVS tool to download the plugin code and the example from the cvs.

I created projects for each sub-project of the code and a single project for the sample.
I can export the 4 jar files representing the plugin.
After I copied these jar files into the eclipse plugin directory I can see that they are active.

Now I open the example project and try to open the BPEL file taken from the CVS and I do get the initially reported error.

does this help?

It is hard to tell what is wrong. Try using Eclipse as an IDE and using the CVS support from Eclipse plus following the instructions again. Once we have builds (not sure yet when) it will be easier to install.

rodrigo,

thanks for your help. I did as you stated and it works now, although I have no clue why the previous installation didn't worked.

The problem is solved!

Thanks again for the fast support!

--Andreas
